resources.string: This widget hosts two SyncedScrollView children. It has an optional parameter to set a scroll factor, which will in turn cause the opposing SyncedScrollView to be scrolled at a different rate. This widget can be very useful for synchronized scrolling of two SyncedScrollView children, or for parallax-style scrolling in a over-under fashion.
These two ScrollViews are synced and locked. Clicking the button causes the left column to scroll to the top, and the right column mimics the position.
They scroll at the same rate. They lock to the position of each other. There is extra text in this column to illustrate how the views lock.
These two ScrollViews are synced and unlocked. They scroll based on the difference in scrolling of the opposing view, _not_ the position of the opposing view.
They scroll at the same rate. They do not lock to the position of each other.
These two ScrollViews are unsynced and unlocked. They scroll based on the difference in scrolling of the opposing view, _not_ the position of the opposing view.
The right ScrollView scrolls at 3x the rate of the left one. They do not lock to the position of each other.

These two ScrollViews are synced via onMotionEvent() and unlocked. They use equivalent MotionEvents. This makes it possible for the receiving ScrollView to continue to scroll even when the dispatching ScrollView is already at the top or bottom.
They scroll only based on the MotionEvents triggered by the opposing ScrollView. They do not lock to the position of each other.
